net.codemusic.smartears
Class RangeManager

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--net.codemusic.smartears.RangeManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
IRangeManager
public class RangeManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRangeManager

This class manages the user-defined range of pitches that sounds should be played in

Constructor Summary
RangeManager()
           
 
Method Summary
 int getLowerBound()
          This accessor method returns an int representing the MIDI note value of the lowest allowable pitch
 int getUpperBound()
          This accessor method returns an int representing the MIDI note value of the highest allowable pitch
 boolean isWithinRange(int note)
          Returns a boolean indicating whether the supplied note is between the upper and lower bounds (inclusive)
 int selectBase(IAnswer answer)
          Using the supplied answer's span, selects a random base note that will ensure that the answer will fit within the current range boundaries.
 void setLowerBound(int lowerBound)
          lowerBound must be between 21 and 107 (piano keyboard range)
 void setUpperBound(int upperBound)
          upperBound must be between 22 and 108
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

isWithinRange

public boolean isWithinRange(int note)
Returns a boolean indicating whether the supplied note is between the upper and lower bounds (inclusive)

Specified by:
isWithinRange in interface IRangeManager

selectBase

public int selectBase(IAnswer answer)
               throws RangeException
Using the supplied answer's span, selects a random base note that will ensure that the answer will fit within the current range boundaries.

Specified by:
selectBase in interface IRangeManager
Returns:
a MIDI note value that can be used as the base note of this answer and keep all notes within the range
Throws:
RangeException - is thrown if the answer's span is too big for the current range
